abstract: Explicitly indicates that a block in the group finished executing.
overview:
## Discussion

Calling this function decrements the current count of outstanding tasks in the group. Using this function (with [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/enter()]) allows your application to properly manage the task reference count if it explicitly adds and removes tasks from the group by a means other than using the [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_async] function.

A call to this function must balance a call to [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/enter()]. It is invalid to call it more times than [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/enter()], which would result in a negative count.

# leave()

**Instance Method**

Explicitly indicates that a block in the group finished executing.

## Declaration

```swift
func leave()
```

## Discussion

Calling this function decrements the current count of outstanding tasks in the group. Using this function (with [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/enter()]) allows your application to properly manage the task reference count if it explicitly adds and removes tasks from the group by a means other than using the [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/dispatch_group_async] function.

A call to this function must balance a call to [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/enter()]. It is invalid to call it more times than [doc://com.apple.dispatch/documentation/Dispatch/DispatchGroup/enter()], which would result in a negative count.

## Updating the Group Manually

- **enter()**: Explicitly indicates that a block has entered the group.
